solution.text:
we can clearly imagine that the triangle with base as palm tree and bigger triangle with base as tower are similar
let the height of the palm tree be \(h\)
as triangles are similar we can write, \(\frac hH=\frac lL\)
Putting \( L=_{{3*k}}_ , l=_{k}_, H= _{{6*j}}_\), we get
\(\frac h{_{{6*j}}_}=\frac {_{k}_}{_{{3*k}}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{6*j}}_\times \frac 13=h\)
hence,\(h=_{{2*j}}_ \)m

content.text:
A tower of _{{6*j}}_m height casts a shadow of _{{3*k}}_.
At the same time if a palm tree casts a shadow of _{k}_metres, find the height of the palm tree
